remarks: Lemma for ~ mapdpg .  Baer p. 45, lines 1 and 2:  "we have (F(x-y))* = Gt where t necessarily belongs to (Fx)*+(Fy)*."  (We scope $d ` t ph ` locally to avoid clashes with later substitutions into ` ph ` .) (Contributed by NM, 15-Mar-2015.)
statement:
mapdpglem.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
mapdpglem.m $e |- M = ( ( mapd ` K ) ` W ) $.
mapdpglem.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
mapdpglem.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
mapdpglem.s $e |- .- = ( -g ` U ) $.
mapdpglem.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` U ) $.
mapdpglem.c $e |- C = ( ( LCDual ` K ) ` W ) $.
mapdpglem.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
mapdpglem.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
mapdpglem.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. V ) $.
mapdpglem1.p $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` C ) $.
mapdpglem2.j $e |- J = ( LSpan ` C ) $.
mapdpglem2 $p |- ( ph -> E. t e. ( ( M ` ( N ` { X } ) ) .(+) ( M ` ( N ` { Y } ) ) ) ( M ` ( N ` { ( X .- Y ) } ) ) = ( J ` { t } ) ) $.
$d .- t $.
$d C t $.
$d J t $.
$d M t $.
$d N t $.
$d X t $.
$d Y t $.
$d ph t $.
